alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Martin, southeastern Johnson and northeastern Floyd Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 439 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Boons Camp, or near Paintsville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Prestonsburg, Odds, Davisport, Nero, Auxier, Delong, Bays Branch, Pevier and Debord around 450 PM EDT. Davella and Preece around 455 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lancer, Prince, Pleasant, Corn Fork Hollow, Endicott, Moree, Alvin, Emma and Threeforks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
